function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'selection_sort'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'selection_sort'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < n' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < n' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'j < n' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'j < n' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < n' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j < n' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'A (line 2)' used after its definition?
Does the value assigned to 'n (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'i (line 3)' live at the end of function 'selection_sort'?
Does variable 'temp' remain in use at the end of function 'selection_sort'?
dead_code: Can the program actually reach the statement: “int n = sizeof(A) / sizeof(int);”?
